channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Spanish ‘soonicorn’ Multiverse Computing releases free compressed AI model
item.description: Spanish startup Multiverse Computing has released a new version of its HyperNova 60B model on Hugging Face that, it says, bests Mistral's model.

item.title: LG's massive 52-inch ultra-wide gaming monitor costs $2,000
item.description: LG kicked off the year by unveiling a new lineup of gaming monitors, and today the company has priced out the biggest of the bunch. The UltraGear evo G9 (52G930B) is now available for pre-order, and the massive screen will cost just $2,000. Yes, you can buy a perfectly excellent gaming monitor for much less, but $2,000 is a surprisingly low price tag for this 52-inch ultrawide monitor with a 1000R curve, which LG is billing as "the world's largest 5K2K gaming monitor." In addition to its huge size, the G9 can run at a 240Hz refresh rate and offers a 1 millisecond gray-to-gray response rate. V...

item.title: Here’s What a Google Subpoena Response Looks Like, Courtesy of the Epstein Files
item.description: The US Justice Department disclosures give fresh clues about how tech companies handle government inquiries about your data.

item.title: Apple rolls out age verification tools worldwide to comply with growing web of child safety laws
item.description: Apple complies with new age assurance laws in the U.S. and abroad, including those that block users from downloading apps aimed at adults.

item.title: Apple's touchscreen MacBook will reportedly have a dynamic interface
item.description: Apple's plan to add touchscreens to its premium MacBook Pros is coming into focus. Bloomberg reports that when the new laptops launch this fall, they'll feature a Dynamic Island, not unlike Apple's iPhones, and an interface that changes depending on where you touch your Macbook's screen.This "dynamic interface" is reportedly designed to make the transition between mouse input and touch input smoother on Apple's new laptops. Bloomberg says that if users touch an onscreen button, the version of macOS running on these new MacBook Pros will be able to pull up a contextual menu "that provides more ...

item.title: Okay, This AI-Powered ‘Robot Phone’ Has My Undivided Attention
item.description: The next big thing for phones after foldables?

item.title: Trump Claims the State of the Union Is Going to Be Long. Is It Just a Polymarket Pump?
item.description: Someone clearly wants the public to believe Trump will speak for more than two hours.

item.title: Uber engineers built an AI version of their boss
item.description: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said the company’s employees have gone all in on AI, going so far as to build a chatbot of him that they use to practice their pitches.

item.title: OpenAI defeats xAI’s trade secrets lawsuit
item.description: OpenAI won a victory Tuesday in one of its legal battles with xAI, which involved allegations of poaching and theft of trade secrets. The former company's motion to dismiss the lawsuit was granted on Tuesday with leave to amend, meaning xAI has the option to refile with modified claims. In the ruling, US District Judge […]

item.title: World’s largest SSD has tripled in price in just nine months and now costs more than a new car
item.description: World’s largest SSD has tripled in price in just nine months and now costs $37,128, roughly $302 per terabyte.

item.title: Jodie Foster Reflects on the Personal Journey of Making ‘Contact’
item.description: The Oscar-winning actress appeared in Los Angeles this week to discuss the 1997 Robert Zemeckis film.

item.title: Dell and Lenovo laptops with Nvidia CPUs 'could come in the first half of this year' — so get ready for some thin-and-light gaming powerhouses (hopefully)
item.description: Nvidia's new Arm CPU could debut in laptops in Q2 2026 — but I'm skeptical we'll see these notebooks anytime soon.

item.title: The era of human web search is over: Nimble launches Agentic Search Platform for enterprises boasting 99% accuracy
item.description: Web Search has already been disrupted by AI — just take a look at how readily Google is presenting users with AI Overviews (summaries of search results) at the top of their results pages, how Bing early on integrated OpenAI's GPT models, and how Perplexity continues to build on its own AI-driven web search platform and browsers. Nimble announced the launch of its Agentic Search Platform, a system designed to transform the public web into trusted, decision-grade data for AI systems and business workflows. The launch is supported by $47 million in Series B financing led by Norwest, with particip...

item.title: Stripe is reportedly eyeing deal to buy some or all of PayPal
item.description: Stripe might be looking to buy PayPal, or parts of it, per early reports.

item.title: Warner Bros. Has Decided That Maybe Paramount Could Be the Better Deal After All
item.description: The battle between Paramount and Netflix over Warner Bros. has taken a new turn.

item.title: Meta Gets Back into Crypto, Plans Stablecoin Integration Later This Year
item.description: Remember Meta's Libra Project, later renamed "Diem?" Well now Meta appears to be moving ahead with a stablecoin that is neither of those.

item.title: I reviewed this delightfully retro DAC dongle and at this price, it's a punchy and talented no-brainer
item.description: FiiO's ultra-portable wired DAC delivers a significant audio upgrade to your computer, smartphone or tablet

item.title: IBM's $40B stock wipeout is built on a misconception: Translating COBOL isn't the same as modernizing it
item.description: On Tuesday, Anthropic published tools that let Claude read, analyze and translate legacy COBOL into modern languages like Java and Python. By the end of the trading day, investors had wiped roughly $40 billion from IBM's market cap — the company's biggest single-day drop in 25 years — pricing the announcement as an existential threat to IBM's mainframe business.The reaction was swift. It was also built on a fundamental misreading of why enterprises run mainframes in the first place.IBM's COBOL is 66 years old. It was designed in 1959, runs on IBM mainframes, and continues to power transaction ...

item.title: Former L3Harris Trenchant boss jailed for selling hacking tools to Russian broker
item.description: Peter Williams, the former head of U.S. hacking tools maker L3Harris Trenchant, was sentenced to seven years in prison for stealing and selling his former company’s hacking and surveillance tools to a Russian firm.

item.title: Gucci just proved why luxury brands shouldn’t use AI
item.description: The iconic fashion house may have learned a tough lesson about advertising. What are the hallmarks of a luxury brand? Exclusivity, artisan craftsmanship, and a high price tag to match. But iconic fashion house Gucci may have just learned the hard way that advertising can undermine all those qualities—especially if it’s made with AI.

item.title: Pete Hegseth Gives Anthropic Choice to Abandon AI Safeguards or Be Labeled ‘National Security Threat’
item.description: Taking a hit for upholding safeguards probably isn't the worst thing for your reputation.

item.title: Apple users beware — this devious malware can hide its activity while it hijacks your camera and microphone
item.description: Predator spyware bypasses iOS camera and microphone indicators by hooking system processes, enabling covert surveillance despite standard privacy protections.
